column2: ALABAMA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Alabama
column6: AL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Stop.
column6: Yield.

column2: 2. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column4: under no circumstances.
column6: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 3. If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim the lights, you should look:
column4: toward the right side of the road.
column6: toward the center of the roadway.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: No U-turns

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 7. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: delay near it.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 8. Which of the following factors affect the absorption of alcohol?
column4: Your race.
column6: Your weight.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 10. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.
column6: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.
column8: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 12. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead.
column6: Divided highway ends.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 14. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 15. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column4: Tranquilizers and sedatives.
column6: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.

column2: 16. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column6: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.

column2: 17. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 18. The first thing affected after drinking alcohol is:
column4: balance.
column6: judgment.

column2: 19. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 20. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column4: low beam headlights.
column6: parking lights.

column2: 21. What does this sign indicate?
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 22. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.

column2: 23. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.
column6: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.

column2: 24. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
column6: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.

column2: 25. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Replacing worn wiper blades.
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 26. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the type of route you are on.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 27. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 28. When daylight begins to fade, you should use your:
column4: low beam headlights.
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 29. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column4: on the right.
column6: directly behind them.

column2: 30. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 31. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you cannot pass.
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 32. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 33. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column6: Brake early and gently.

column2: 34. This is:
column4: a side road sign.
column6: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 35. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Diamond
column6: Triangle

column2: 36. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: move to another lane if possible.
column6: activate your stop lights.

column2: 37. A diamond-shaped sign is a:
column4: school zone sign.
column6: warning sign.

column2: 38. No Zones are areas around trucks where cars:
column4: disappear into blind spots or are so close to the truck that the driver's ability to stop or maneuver safely is restricted.
column6: can turn safely because several car lengths have been left between the truck and car.
column8: can travel behind trucks at constant speed and have no risks of being involved in a collision.

column2: 39. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: make a U-turn.
column6: look for a detour or another route.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 40. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: A school crossing
column6: Yield
